title: The Tabernacle Offerings
shortSummary: Exodus 35 details Moses' instructions to the Israelites regarding the observance of the Sabbath and the collection of offerings for the construction of the Tabernacle. The chapter highlights the willing hearts of the people as they bring materials and gifts, and it introduces Bezaleel and Aholiab, skilled craftsmen empowered by God to lead the work. This chapter emphasizes obedience, worship, and the Spirit’s empowerment in service to the Lord.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and Wilderness Journey

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who conveys God's commands about Sabbath observance and the offerings for the Tabernacle.

keyCharacters.name: Bezaleel
keyCharacters.description: A skilled craftsman from the tribe of Judah, filled with the Spirit of God to lead the artistic work of the Tabernacle.

keyCharacters.name: Aholiab
keyCharacters.description: A craftsman from the tribe of Dan, appointed alongside Bezaleel to teach and execute the intricate work for the Tabernacle.

definitions.definition: The seventh day of the week set apart as a holy day of rest and worship, commanded by God.
A durable acacia wood used extensively in the construction of the Tabernacle’s framework.
A sacred garment worn by the high priest, often adorned with precious stones, used in priestly service.
The gold cover on the Ark of the Covenant, symbolizing God's presence and mercy.
A voluntary and joyful attitude to give or serve, reflecting genuine devotion to God.

outline.heading: Command to Observe the Sabbath
outline.description: Moses reminds the Israelites of God's command to keep the Sabbath holy by resting and refraining from work, emphasizing the seriousness of this command as a sign of obedience and reverence.

outline.heading: Call for Offerings for the Tabernacle
outline.description: God commands Moses to collect offerings from willing hearts, specifying materials such as gold, silver, brass, fine linens, and spices needed for the Tabernacle’s construction and worship.

outline.heading: Skilled Workmen and Materials for the Tabernacle
outline.description: Instructions are given for the making of every part of the Tabernacle and its furnishings, highlighting the importance of craftsmanship and obedience to God’s detailed design.

outline.heading: The People’s Generous Response
outline.description: The Israelites respond with enthusiasm and generosity, bringing abundant offerings of gold, fabrics, spices, and other materials, demonstrating their willing hearts and unity in worship.

outline.heading: God’s Empowerment of Bezaleel and Aholiab
outline.description: God fills Bezaleel and Aholiab with His Spirit, granting them wisdom, understanding, and skill to lead the artistic and technical work of the Tabernacle, underscoring divine empowerment in service.

application: Honor God’s commands by setting aside regular times of rest and worship, recognizing the Sabbath as a gift for spiritual renewal.
Give willingly and joyfully to God’s work, understanding that offerings are acts of worship reflecting a heart devoted to Him.
Use the gifts and talents God has given you to serve Him and others, seeking His wisdom and empowerment in all you do.
Recognize the importance of obedience to God’s detailed instructions as an expression of faith and reverence.

keyVerses.text: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be to you an holy day, a sabbath of rest to the LORD: whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the holiness of the Sabbath and the seriousness with which God requires obedience to His commands.

keyVerses.text: And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and they brought the LORD'S offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the importance of a willing heart in giving and serving God, showing that true worship flows from the Spirit’s prompting.

keyVerses.text: And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals that God equips His servants with the necessary skills and wisdom to accomplish His work.
